content: starship enterprise amigurumi what to know it doesn t really matter what material or size of yarn you use as long as your gauge is consistent it ll come out fine do not join between rounds unless specified use a stitch marker or scrap of yarn to mark the beginnings of rounds all parts are crocheted in gray yarn then embroidered abbreviations blo = back loop only chain = chain flo = front loop only inv decrease = invisible decrease starship enterprise amigurumi single_crochet = single_crochet st s = stitch es whether you call it cute nerdy or simply ncc-1701-x this amigurumi is a great way to put a lot of trek in a tiny package great as a tree ornament above a crib hanging from your desk lamp or rear view mirror check state laws of course or for cuddling on the couch if you make a really big one this pattern is a general approximation of various early models of the uss enterprise it s too small to fit much specific detail but that s okay because being too literal takes away the cuteness inherent in amigurumi i encourage you to choose colors and embroider as you please so as to do justice to your favorite ncc-1701 version materials needed approximately 25 grams of gray dk yarn small amounts of dk or similar yarn in embellishment colors i used white black red and blue 3 25mm crochet hook us size d or appropriate size for your yarn tapestry needle small amounts of stuffing skills needed techniques explained basic crochet stitches invisible decrease there are no techniques that are unique to this pattern but a couple that are lesser used french knot i encourage you to search for online videos on these techniques since there are many basic embroidery and assembly that demonstrate far better than i can explain here finished size inv decrease about 3-3/4 long insert your hook first into the front loop of the first stitch then also into the front loop of the second stitch with two front-loops on your hook complete the rest of a typical single_crochet stitch wrap the yarn and pull through both loops then wrap the yarn and pull through the last two loops you have now decreased two stitches to one stitch invisibly to perform an inv decrease in blo instead of inserting your hook in between the front and back loops as you normally would insert your hook into the back loops from the reverse direction in other words insert from the backside of the stitches complete the rest of the invisible decrease as you normally would french knot this is a technique borrowed from needlepoint thread the yarn onto a tapestry needle insert needle from back to front emerging at the outside of work piece at the location you want your knot and pull through about 6 inches of yarn holding the needle in your right hand pinch the yarn with
